oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of three US soldiers.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The photograph belonged to Dallas Walton Newsom of North Carolina. He was appointed into the Reserve Officer Training Camp from Trinity College (now Duke Univ.) and is seen lying on the first cot. He attended the course of instruction at Plattsburg, NY. He returned to Trinity College after the war. Apparently taken during the summer or just prior to moving, the photograph shows the lines for the tent, yet the tent is wrapped around the center pole.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Newsom, Dallas Walton;
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
